slides.title: Welcome to ACCA TX
slides.content:
# Taxation (TX)

TX covers the **UK tax system** and its application to individuals and companies.

## What You Will Learn

- **Income Tax** - Personal taxation
- **Corporation Tax** - Company taxation
- **CGT** - Capital gains tax
- **VAT** - Value added tax

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Income tax | 30% |
| Corporation tax | 25% |
| CGT | 15% |
| IHT | 10% |
| VAT | 15% |
| Tax admin | 5% |

slides.title: Income Tax Basics
slides.content:
# Income Tax

## Taxable Person

- UK resident individuals
- Tax year: 6 April to 5 April

## Types of Income

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Employment | Salary, bonuses |
| Self-employment | Trading profits |
| Property | Rental income |
| Savings | Interest |
| Dividends | Company distributions |

## Personal Allowance

```
Personal Allowance (PA)
- Reduces taxable income
- Tapered at high income
- Lost above threshold
```

slides.title: Income Tax Rates
slides.content:
# Tax Bands and Rates

## Non-Savings Income

| Band | Rate |
|------|------|
| Basic rate | 20% |
| Higher rate | 40% |
| Additional rate | 45% |

## Savings Income

| Band | Rate |
|------|------|
| Starting rate | 0% |
| Basic rate | 20% |
| Higher rate | 40% |
| Additional rate | 45% |

## Dividend Income

| Band | Rate |
|------|------|
| Basic rate | 8.75% |
| Higher rate | 33.75% |
| Additional rate | 39.35% |

## Dividend Allowance

- First allowance at 0%

slides.title: Employment Income
slides.content:
# Employment Income

## Taxable Benefits

| Benefit | Taxable Amount |
|---------|---------------|
| Company car | % of list price |
| Fuel benefit | Fixed multiplier |
| Accommodation | Annual value |
| Medical insurance | Cost to employer |

## Exempt Benefits

- Pension contributions
- Workplace parking
- Mobile phone (one)
- Trivial benefits

## PAYE System

```
Pay As You Earn:
- Tax collected at source
- Employer responsibility
- Tax codes applied
```

slides.title: Trading Income
slides.content:
# Self-Employment

## Basis of Assessment

- Current Year Basis (CYB)
- Accounting period profits
- Adjustments required

## Adjustment of Profits

```
Accounting Profit
+ Disallowable expenses
- Tax-free income
= Taxable Trading Profit
```

## Disallowable Expenses

| Expense | Treatment |
|---------|----------|
| Depreciation | Add back |
| Private use | Add back portion |
| Entertainment | Add back |
| Capital items | Add back |

## Capital Allowances

- Replace depreciation
- Annual Investment Allowance
- Writing Down Allowance

slides.title: Capital Allowances
slides.content:
# Capital Allowances

## Annual Investment Allowance

```
100% deduction on qualifying assets
Up to annual limit
```

## Writing Down Allowance

| Pool | Rate |
|------|------|
| Main pool | 18% |
| Special rate | 6% |

## Calculation

```
Brought forward balance
+ Additions (not AIA)
- Disposals (lower of cost/proceeds)
= Pool balance
x WDA rate
= Capital allowance
```

## Assets

| Main Pool | Special Rate |
|-----------|-------------|
| Plant & machinery | Cars > 50g/km CO2 |
| Most equipment | Integral features |

slides.title: Corporation Tax
slides.content:
# Corporation Tax

## Chargeable Persons

- UK resident companies
- Accounting period basis

## Taxable Total Profits

```
Trading Income
+ Property Income
+ Investment Income
+ Chargeable Gains
- Qualifying Donations
= Taxable Total Profits
```

## Corporation Tax Rates

| Profits | Rate |
|---------|------|
| Small profits rate | 19% |
| Main rate | 25% |
| Marginal relief | Between thresholds |

## Payment Dates

- Small companies: 9 months + 1 day
- Large companies: Quarterly installments

slides.title: Corporation Tax Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: When must a small company pay its corporation tax?
quizOptions: 9 months and 1 day after year end

slides.title: Capital Gains Tax
slides.content:
# Capital Gains Tax

## Chargeable Disposals

- Sale of assets
- Gift of assets
- Loss or destruction

## CGT Calculation

```
Proceeds (or market value)
- Allowable costs
- Enhancement expenditure
= Chargeable Gain
- Annual Exempt Amount
= Taxable Gain
```

## CGT Rates

| Asset Type | Basic Rate | Higher Rate |
|------------|------------|-------------|
| Most assets | 10% | 20% |
| Residential property | 18% | 28% |

## Reliefs

| Relief | Effect |
|--------|--------|
| Business Asset Disposal Relief | 10% rate |
| Rollover Relief | Defer gain |
| Gift Relief | Defer gain |

slides.title: Inheritance Tax
slides.content:
# Inheritance Tax

## When Charged

- Death transfers
- Lifetime gifts (some)
- Trusts

## IHT Calculation

```
Gross Estate
- Exempt transfers
- Nil Rate Band
= Taxable Estate
x 40%
= IHT payable
```

## Exemptions

| Exemption | Amount |
|-----------|--------|
| Spouse exemption | Unlimited |
| Annual exemption | Per year |
| Small gifts | Per person |
| Normal expenditure | Regular gifts |

## Taper Relief

Gifts 3-7 years before death:
- Reduced tax rate
- Graduated reduction

slides.title: VAT Basics
slides.content:
# Value Added Tax

## VAT Rates

| Rate | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Standard 20% | Most goods/services |
| Reduced 5% | Fuel, children's car seats |
| Zero 0% | Food, books, children's clothes |
| Exempt | Finance, insurance, education |

## VAT Registration

```
Compulsory: Above threshold
Voluntary: Below threshold

Historic test: Past 12 months
Future test: Next 30 days
```

## VAT Calculation

```
Output VAT (on sales)
- Input VAT (on purchases)
= VAT payable/repayable
```

slides.title: VAT Schemes
slides.content:
# VAT Schemes

## Special Schemes

| Scheme | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Cash accounting | VAT on cash basis |
| Annual accounting | One annual return |
| Flat rate | Fixed % of turnover |

## Flat Rate Scheme

```
Turnover x Flat rate %
= VAT payable

No input VAT recovery
(except capital goods > threshold)
```

## Partial Exemption

```
Mixed supplies:
- Taxable: full recovery
- Exempt: no recovery
- Mixed: pro-rata recovery
```

slides.title: VAT Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is the standard rate of VAT in the UK?

slides.title: National Insurance
slides.content:
# National Insurance

## Classes

| Class | Who Pays |
|-------|----------|
| 1 | Employees |
| 1A | Employers on benefits |
| 2 | Self-employed |
| 4 | Self-employed on profits |

## Class 1 Rates

| Band | Employee | Employer |
|------|----------|----------|
| Below LEL | Nil | Nil |
| LEL to PT | 0% | 0% |
| PT to UEL | 12% | 13.8% |
| Above UEL | 2% | 13.8% |

## Class 4

```
On trading profits:
Main rate on profits below limit
Reduced rate above upper limit
```

slides.title: Tax Administration
slides.content:
# Tax Administration

## Self-Assessment

| Deadline | Requirement |
|----------|-------------|
| 31 Oct | Paper return |
| 31 Jan | Online return |
| 31 Jan | Tax payment |
| 31 July | POA second payment |

## Penalties

| Default | Penalty |
|---------|--------|
| Late filing | Fixed + daily |
| Late payment | % of tax |
| Errors | Behavior-based |

## HMRC Powers

- Information notices
- Enquiries
- Discovery assessments
- Appeals process

slides.title: Tax Planning
slides.content:
# Tax Planning

## Avoidance vs Evasion

| Avoidance | Evasion |
|-----------|--------|
| Legal | Illegal |
| Minimize tax | Hide income |
| Use reliefs | Fraud |

## Planning Strategies

| Strategy | Effect |
|----------|--------|
| Use allowances | Reduce tax |
| Time income | Optimize rates |
| Incorporate | Different rates |
| Pension | Tax relief |

## Anti-Avoidance

- GAAR (General Anti-Abuse Rule)
- Specific anti-avoidance rules
- Disclosure requirements
